column5: Every year I post pictures of the first fresh wild meat meal of the year.  One reason that I do this I do this to remind myself that one of the reasons I love hunting and fishing is the harvest of bounty that were allowed (I like the beer too...  but someone else makes that...)  So here we go...  Moose meat on the BBQ...  tenderloin with Montreal Steak Spice,  loin steak with Bulls Eye BBQ sauce... and round steak in my soya marinade.  a bit of mashed potatoes, some green peas and some rose and  BAM!!!!
Looks Good!!!  I'll take a plate of that!

Good stuff TJ.We had what I thought was the last of the tenderloins Saturday night.Dredged in flour,pan fried in butter and sprinkled with greek seasoning.It dont get no better!Found one more in the freezer tonite while looking for some meat to make jerky.Might try the Montreal steak seasoning on the BBQ for this one.Looks pretty good to me. Joe
Looks great, congrats on your meal. I also had my first wild meal, although not quite like yours, I had a feeding of grouse on the weekend. Makes one feel good and in touch with nature.
Thanks, it's 11:30pm and now all I want to do is forage in the fridge for something to throw on the bbq.
thats one good looking meal  rob
No need to be sorry...nice family, nice home, great meal. That was one big moose  - congrats
A meal fit for a king. Looks good, thanks for making me hungry...again.
Do you do take out?
AW MAN how do you get drool out of a keyboard!!!!!!!
Thanks for making me hungry at 8:30 in the morning.
Nice tradition    Thanks for sharing TJ.........sounds like you had a great time...kind of hard to imagine not having a good time out with good friends!
Where's the rabbit?
~~~There must be somethung wrong with the PM I never got the invite to dinner. Oh well when the next meal
Nice post TJ and what a wonderfull place you have there. I'm jealouse.
Sorry... you better be sorry... Makeing everyone enviouse of you and your life... in T.O. the only wild game is the Gang Banger's and you cant eat them... lol Nice tradition... Peace Ken
It is all about the family in the photo . Looks like a tightknit group congrats!
Dang..I'm starving!!
MEAT!!!!!! it's what's for dinner.  Art

.....Sorry my.......  Got to admit though as others have I'm jealous. I know exactly what I'm missing out on having had the pleasure of sharing in a venison dinner at that very table with you good folks.
What the .......!! Now I'll be in torture as I just started a diet that limits me meat!  Thanks ALOT!!! Bugger, ....  LOL.  So are you going to save some up for a OFNer G2G?
Ill have meat at the next g2g!!
